Strong counter-action against Japan urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Strong counter-action against Japan urged in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The secretary-general of the Institute for National Studies of South Korea in a press interview urged the South Korean authorities to take a stronger counter-action against Japan, recalling they officially declared that they had nothing to settle with Japan as far as its past was concerned, Seoul-based CBS reported.
 He accused the "government" of failing to take any counter-action against Japan though it arrogantly claims that Tok islet belongs to it, charging that the authorities are taking a humiliating and low-key posture in the relations with Japan.    
 He demanded the revision of the "Korea-Japan treaty" signed in 1965 as it is a treaty which was concluded without holding the Japanese imperialists responsible for their colonial rule over Korea and in which Japan's crime-woven history was overlooked to get a petty amount of money in economic aid.

Greetings to Communist Party of Portugal
articles.content:
Greetings to Communist Party of Portugal 
    Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the 
 Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) sent a message of greetings to the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Portugal (CPP) today on the occasion of the 80th anniversary of its foundation.
 The WPK central committee in the message extended warm congratulations and comradely greetings to the central committee and the entire membership of the CPP on this occasion.    
 It expressed belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties would further develop in the common struggle for the victory in the cause of socialism and wished the CPP greater success in the activities to carry out the resolution of its 16th congress.
